title: The Shroud of Turin is Number One on This List
post:
That is a very interesting article!! Fun to read.  I noticed a trend: it seems that things which cannot be explained are dismissed by “experts” as being a hoax.  Why is it so hard to just leave something as “unexplained.” Or “not confirmed.”  I enjoy the mystery. 
Some of those artifacts hint at extra-terrestial life. How fun is that??  I’m not someone who looks for UFO’s and I don’t collect books or belong to clubs. Not interested in getting silly about it… but I do think that if God wanted to put humanoid creatures on other planets He certainly could and can do whatever He wants to do.  It might explain why the planets are so unbelievably far apart: so we don’t corrupt other inhabited planets or influence them. I don’t think the human race would be good for any other “peoples” that might be out there. 
But there’s no way of knowing what God might have done elsewhere. He’s not saying.
author: AnnieCee
